alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 1:17PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Carroll and northern Heard Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 117 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Ranburne to near Roopville, and moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Franklin, Bowdon, Ephesus, Centralhatchee, Roopville, Frolona, Lowell, Plant Wansley, Tyus, Blackjack Mountain and Roosterville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
